title: Georgia to receive award
text:
Slot to Georgia Links (Photo: 247Sports) 
The University of Georgia football program will receive an award on Saturday. Per a school release, the 2015-16 NCAA Sportsmanship Award will be presented during halftime of the Georgia-LSU basketball game. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) 
One of four winners of the award, Georgia earned the honor because of "its first-response care and subsequent support first-response care and subsequent support for injured Southern University football player Devon Gales and his family." Gales suffered a career-ending and life-changing spinal injury on Sept. 26, 2015, during the third quarter of the game against the Bulldogs. Gales continues to rehab at the Shepherd Center in Atlanta. Gales and his family are expected to be on hand for the award presentation.
